abstract: Microsoft is devising ways to raise the stakes in the fight for Yahoo now that its original proposal has been rejected.
snippet: Microsoft is devising ways to raise the stakes in the fight for Yahoo now that its original proposal has been rejected.
lead_paragraph: Yahoo officially rejected Microsoft’s $44.6 billion takeover offer on Monday, calling the bid too low, but Microsoft appeared to signal that it was gearing up for a long acquisition fight.

headline.main: Microsoft Signals Fight for Yahoo Isn’t Over

abstract: With Yahoo’s board rejecting Microsoft’s bid, it will fall to Christopher P. Liddell, an outsider to the software industry, to plot Microsoft’s next steps in the bitter battle.
snippet: With Yahoo’s board rejecting Microsoft’s bid, it will fall to Christopher P. Liddell, an outsider to the software industry, to plot Microsoft’s next steps in the bitter battle.
lead_paragraph: When Yahoo sends its letter rejecting Microsoft’s $44.6 billion on Monday, it will end up in the inbox of a largely unknown executive on Microsoft’s sprawling campus, Christopher P. Liddell.

headline.main: Yahoo Bidder Wants a More Aggressive Microsoft
headline.print_headline: Yahoo Bidder Wants a More Aggressive Microsoft

abstract: When Yahoo sends its letter rejecting Microsoft‘s $44.6 billion on Monday, it will end up in the inbox of a largely unknown executive on Microsoft’s sprawling campus, Christopher P. Liddell.
lead_paragraph: When Yahoo sends its letter rejecting Microsoft‘s $44.6 billion on Monday, it will end up in the inbox of a largely unknown executive on Microsoft’s sprawling campus, Christopher P. Liddell.

headline.main: As Yahoo Balks, Microsoft Plots Next Move

abstract: Not everyone is so reluctant to be bought by Microsoft these days.
lead_paragraph: Not everyone is so reluctant to be bought by Microsoft these days.

headline.main: Microsoft’s Other Takeover Deal: Danger Inc.
It’s Official: Yahoo Rejects Microsoft Bid

abstract: With Yahoo’s shares up slightly on the news that its board has officially rejected the $31 a share bid from Microsoft, it appears investors are betting the company is looking for a better deal, not trying to remain independent.
snippet: With Yahoo’s shares up slightly on the news that its board has officially rejected the $31 a share bid from Microsoft, it appears investors are betting the company is looking for a better deal, not trying to remain independent.
lead_paragraph: So far, investors are showing modest support for Yahoo’s board of directors, which formally rejected Microsoft’s $31-per-share buyout offer this morning.

headline.main: Yahoo Shareholders Believe Company Is Bluffing Microsoft

abstract: Microsoft has already shown its skill in crafting a “bear hug” letter. Now Yahoo has tried its hand at the bid-rejection letter, and the result is remarkably, well, nice — especially when compared with the much harsher rejections that some other companies have issued in recent years.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft has already shown its skill in crafting a “bear hug” letter. Now Yahoo has tried its hand at the bid-rejection letter, and the result is remarkably, well, nice — especially when compared with the much harsher rejections that some other companies have issued in recent years.

headline.main: Yahoo and the Art of the Rejection
